Intervention: - gemcitabine at 1000 mg/m2 administered intravenously for 30-60 minutes on days 1 and 8 in each 3 week (21 day) study cycle.
- gemcitabine at 1250 mg/m2 administered intravenously for 30-60 minutes on days 1 and 8 in each 3-week (21-day) study cycle.
Eligibility: Histologically and/or cytologically confirmed breast cancer
Has received prior chemotherapy for metastatic breast cancer with anthracycline and taxane diet
Have at least one measurable region
To have an adequate function of the organ (bone marrow, liver and kidney function)
To have pore pneumonia or pulmonary fibrosis
Within 28 days of the last chemotherapy or radiotherapy, 14 days after the last hormone/immunotherapy or 7 days after the surgery
• Severe complication (heart infarction, infection, drug hypersensitivity or diabetes)
Results: The best response recorded from the start of treatment to the progression or recurrence of the disease using the solid tumour response assessment criteria (RECIST), which defines when participants improve ("response"), remain the same ("stable") or worsen (" progression") during treatment.
Time frame: basis for measuring progressive disease
Description of the arm/group: Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m2 administered intravenously for 30-60 minutes on days 1 and 8 in each 3-week (21-day) study cycle.
Unit of measure: Participants Complete response: 0
Description of the arm/group: Gemcitabine at 1250 mg/m2 administered intravenously for 30-60 minutes on days 1 and 8 in each 3-week (21-day) study cycle.
Unit of measure: Participants Complete response: 1
